I'm really enjoyed)

Philippe is a great host. He was very quick with responses and the apartment had everything you could need. It was a perfect location for us to visit a whole range of sites in Paris, which we had to do on foot because of a transport strike. I would highly recommend Philippe and his apartment.
The location of the apartment is perfect, many of good restaurants and bars, near to metro. Cute apartment, we felt very comfortable. We had a very great time there.

Philippe's place is in an awesome spot, central to tons of local food! The place feels very safe as there is security on site. It feels more lived in than most places we've stayed, which is good if you're looking for more of a home than a hotel feel. Overall, had a really awesome time staying here!

Me and my partner came to Paris Fashion Week and stayed for 9days, whilst the photos looked great and listed “luxury” my stay was disappointing and far from luxury. The apartment main entrance to the building is off the street and smells because the lift lobby is shared with the communal bins. You then take lift to the 2nd floor then have to walk (approx 50metres) to another building  where you take a 2nd lift to 5th floor. If you have a lot luggage ensure you have someone to help and check what day it is PARIS as the day I arrived was the mayors ‘no car day’ which meant half PARIS roads were closed, the host complained I was late but would’ve been helpful if I was made aware of this and could’ve avoided delays completely. When I arrived with my suitcases to the 2nd floor where security sit I explained I cannot take all my bags In one go to the main apartment building and asked if I could leave one and come back on 2nd trip, they refused so this wasn’t the best start!  Once I got into the apartment the smell of Cigarette smoke was very obvious, I had to go and buy air freshener. I highlighted this to the host manager right away who said he do not smell anything..Cleaning was at a good level and all bed linen was a good standard. As the smoke smells eventually stopped after 3 days, we started to notice all the sellotape used around the flat. On light switches and holding shower pole together. The ceiling in the bathroom has cracks where there looks like there was a flood from apartment above, cracks in bedroom mirror and bathroom tiles. to top off this stay, you’re overlooking a construction site with early morning noise and we had a power problems, the worse on the last night whilst we packed our suitcases and couldn’t see anything, we contacted the managing host straight away, he asked for photo of the electrical board and this was sent straight away and then we had no response until I chased the next day. Very disappointing, not recommended.

Philippe's apartment is in a fantastic, central location for navigating the city within a short walk of a major metro stop.  The apartment itself is well stocked and we had access to everything we needed to have a great trip.  There's a grocery store within a block or two of the house where you can buy deli items, groceries, house supplies, clothes, et cetera (akin to a US Target store).  The apartment has wonderful light (and light blocking curtains for a good night sleep) and comfortable, yet spacious living space.

just in front of Montparnasse station.
good access to anywhere in Paris!
Excellent location near Metro, Train Station, and Buses to the airport.  Enjoyed the spacious apartment that was clean.  When a problem did occurred, the apt manager had it fixed immediately.

Based on our recent experience, we would definitely NOT rent this apartment again NOR would we work with this host again.

This apartment was FAR FROM a Luxury Apartment (as it was described in the listing). Based on our in-person experience, the listing photos seem enhanced ... the condition, look, and cleanliness of the apt was definitely not the same as pictured (Good Photographer though I guess). So, photos appear to be only halfway accurate AND areas not shown in the listing were bigger problems. The Cleaning Lady was working on the apartment from before we arrived to 45 minutes after. Even so, there were issues throughout the apt but especially the bathroom (moldy shower curtain ... cleaning attempted but blackish stains remained, peeling paint, used bar soap, stained towel, etc) and kitchen/fridge (undefrosted/grossly over-frozen ice box, old food remnants and stains in a very old fridge, floor had been cleaned but still looked dirty). Sink and countertops were clean enough but we were uncomfortable and tried to use the kitchen as little as possible. The A/C unit was completely ineffective (maybe this was the reason for 2 additional dirty fans but unless directly in front of them, they were also ineffective). Also, I still don’t know if there was actually WiFi in the apt as we were given no access info.  Beds were okay, again nothing luxurious or even mid range but comfortable enough to sleep (if not for the heat in the apt due to the ineffective A/C).

Philippe, the host, planned to meet us at the apartment for our afternoon check-in. He decided not to meet with us about 2 hours before check-in, stating it was a National Holiday. The National Holiday was not new information. This could have been okay if the Cleaning Lady had not been cleaning the apt for the first 45 minutes, the condition of the apt had not been such a disappointment (even after the Cleaning Lady was done) as explained above, the apt had been closer to expectations based on the listing, if the A/C was not ineffective, if we would have had access to the “Included WiFi”, and if we would not have lost complete contact with the host. For the record, since we never received any WiFi Info, I can’t say for sure if there was WiFi or not.

Philippe did provide detailed instructions on how to gain access to the apartment (We would not have made it to the apt without that ... There was a gated entry door, 2 seperate elevators, a walkway, some stairs, a code, and 2 keys). Unfortunately, Philippe communicated well UNTIL we accessed the apt, expressed concerns about it, sent him photos of our concerns, and requested resolutions. Then no response ... ever ... just radio silence.
Très bon logement, emplacement top, tout est à côté !
appartement joli et tres confortable. emplacement idéal pour sortir a paris

Nous n'avons pas été hébergé dans ce logement. Ayant un soucis de plomberie, nous avons été logés dans un appartement situé dans le 1er arrondissement. 
Celui-ci était très bien décoré mais la propreté du logement était à revoir, notamment le sol. 
Cependant la réactivité de l'équipe est top.

Nous avons passé une excellente nuit. Merci à la réceptionniste que j'ai eu par téléphone très disponible et agréable. 
l'appartement est décoré avec goût et très propre. La situation de ce Airbnb est trés intéressante. 
Vraiment je reviendrai avec plaisir.

Les plus : 
Appartement agréable et bien placé. 
Le métro se trouve a quelques pas seulement (la ligne est directe pour aller à la Gare de Lyon en seulement 15 minutes). 
Il y a des restaurants juste en bas, et un centre commercial où vous pouvez faire vos courses  à 3 minutes à pieds !
La décoration est assez jolie. 
Il y a un ascenseur dans le bâtiment, très pratique quand on arrive avec les valises. 

Les moins : 
Toutes les pièces sont des chambres , il n’y a pas de coin canapé. 
Le coin cuisine est tout petit, et il n’y a pas d’essentiels comme du sel ou de l’huile d’olive (rien de grave si vous n’avez pas prévu de manger à l’appart, mais des condiments seraient un plus). 
Une des chambres n’a pas de fenêtre. 
Si vous aimez dormir la fenêtre ouverte, attendez vous a entendre du bruit toute la nuit (quartier animé, et circulation continue). 

Le séjour a été agréable dans l’ensemble. L’appartement est très bien pour un séjour de quelques jours. 
La communication est top, tout est bien organisé pour l’arrivée avec des codes à chaque porte pour pouvoir entrer. 
L’immeuble est propre et sécurisé.
Tres bonne experience, appartement tres beau, confortable et pratique. Excellent emplacement et communication fluide avec le propriétaire. Rien à redire ! Sejour parfait !

Le logement est très bien situé, très proche de la gare. Très propre et bien décoré. Seul bémol pour le bruit. Les murs et les portes n’étant pas très épais, nous avons été réveillés par des discussions et des bruits dans le couloir ...
Super logement

Appartement très bien situé, très pratique, et bien insonorisé!

Appartement propre et design. Bien placé et bien desservi par les transports en commun. Hôte très réactif. Je recommande pour un court séjour sur Paris
L'appartement de Sébastien est très bien situé près de la gare Saint-Lazarre et très bien isolé du bruit. Parfait si vous voulez visiter Paris sans passer des heures dans les transports en commun.
L’appartement est propre et bien situé, la déco est soignée. Pour notre part, nous y avons eu chaud en période de forte chaleur.
Super appartement situé au cœur de la ville de Paris. La décoration est extraordinaire et la communication avec les propriétaires est irréprochable.
Super appartement. Bien placé, non loin du boulevard Haussmann. Appartement très propre.
Nickel, emplacement idéal, propreté impeccable, que du ++

Superbe appartement très bien placé
Appartement agréable et très bien situé.
Appartement tres bien placé, fonctionnel, propre, facile d accès.
Super accueil, appartement très bien situé, je recommande !

Appartement correct mais bruyant : nous avons entendu les voisins à travers la cloison, ce qui nous a empêché de dormir. L’immeuble est en fait un plateau divisé en plusieurs appartements collés et dédiés au airbnb, rien de problématique en soit mais l’isolation aurait pu etre mieux pensée. Tout est automatisé pour l’entrée des lieux : 4 codes pour passer les différentes portes, ne vous attendez pas à croiser le propriétaire pour vous accueillir.
L appartement est conforme aux descriptions et idéalement bien placé !
L’appartement est propre, très bien placé et conforme à la description.

Très bon séjour dans un appart propre et très bien situé, à proximité de toute commodité et de lieux touristiques tels que le Musée du Louvre, champs (Website hidden by Airbnb) est également bien desservi en moyen de transport, très utile pour aller voir la Tour Eiffel etc..Je vous le conseille très fortement.

Excellente adresse ! Très bien située, à proximité de la gare, de nombreux commerces et des grands magasins. Quartier agréable, doubles fenêtres donc aucun bruit de l’extérieur dans l’appartement. La décoration est très soignée. 
Prenez des boules Quies si vous êtes sensible au bruit parce que la VMC est un peu bruyante.
logement très bien placé, très facile d'accès
Séjour superbe dans ce bel appartement proche de St Lazare. Métro et taxi en bas de l’immeuble. Deco magnifique. Très calme malgré qu’il soit côté boulevard. Pas déçue du tout !!

Emplacement idéal pour acceder à pied a Galeries Lafayette, Printemps, le Louvre, Palais Royal etc.

Trop petit pour le Prix payé et pour 5 personnes. Le ménage n'etait pas bien fait. On a été réveillés a 9h du matin dimanche alors que le check out était à 11h.
L'appartement de Sébastien est très agréable, bien situé, agencé et décoré avec beaucoup de goût. J'y retournerai sans hésiter.
The apartment is very good situated, spacious with 3 beds/rooms, and ambulance is quite nice. I am gladly recommend it to others .
We had a very pleasent stay! The apartment was in a really beautiful builing, renovated, very clean and comfortable! Thank you really much, Sebastien!

Great location. Easy access to public transportation. Coffee spots and restaurants nearby.  Very clean unit. The access codes to get in was a little overwhelming but very safe nonetheless. Overall, it was a great stay for my family of 4 adults and a child.

Very nice place, much like a hotel room with very small kitchen area. The beds were comfortable and the shower was nice. The location was excellent, especially for the price. We loved the elevator and stairs - very beautiful building! We would definitely return and do recommend this place to others.
Все отлично. Нет квеста с заселением. Удачное расположение

Central location; complicated entry and exit which was not insurmountable. The photos make the place appear more spacious with the mirrors, and the details of the room could use some work (ie, flooring is some sort of vinyl/sticker).  I would recommend staying here for a day or two, but wouldn’t want to be here any longer with a group of 4 or larger. Towels had been damp as well. Very small elevator to get into the unit.
抱歉退房晚了10分钟.房间整体位置有优势,商场､地铁很方便.房间卫生不太好,床单､毛巾､浴巾都有些发灰,窗台都是尘土.房东对时间要求比较严格,不允许提前入住,存放行李也不行.退房的时候因为正好赶上法国前总统葬礼所以送机的车晚了10分钟,遭到了房东的严词拒绝并要求多支付房款｡
Great place that was very reasonable. This is perfect for 2 couples or 3 different people. It’s located next to a metro station and within walking distance to Harry’s New York Bar! Highly recommend.

This apartment was spotless with beautiful decorations. The August heat was definitely present during our trip but there were conveniently two fans provided. Finding the apartment was easy and the instructions were spot on. Although the apartment was smaller than I anticipated, it was lovely with treat views of the Parisian buildings. We used Uber to get around because that was easier for us but the public transportation was also convenient to use. We could walk to the Moulin Rouge, Montmartre and plenty of night life. It was an overall fantastic stay, I highly recommend.

The apartment was beautiful; truly a Parisian palace. It was conveniently located across from a major train station, and there’s lots of food, groceries and shops nearby. I would definitely recommend staying here!
Great stay! Amazing location, easy check in and the host was fabulous with communication and help!
就在地铁出口旁,出行方便｡走到老佛爷也就十几分钟,买东西也很方便｡

This was perfect for our family of 5. All the beds were comfortable. There are two doubles (one in the living space and one in a private bedroom) and a twin (in a small private room). The shower had hot water and there was a very small kitchenette we used as an additional sink. We loved that there were many mirrors since the bathroom is small and we have two teenage daughters. Lots of space to spread out. The location was great... Close to the Opera House and St. Lazare train station. There is a small elevator if you don't want to climb the stairs. Very clean and comfortable!

Ici ou ailleurs...peu importe ? Non !
Paris tout de même, St Germain qui plus est ! Le rêve a rêvé de liberté, de ciel bleu, d'étoiles et de confidences... Les murs de la Louisiane se sont inventées bouteille à la mer...Le rêve a rêvé de bleu nuit pour accueillir les nuances de chaque vert  au rai de lumière ambrée du petit matin ...L'espace d'une chambre que l'on pense hermétique devient  ici et ailleurs, champ des possibles...
Hôtel très bien situé dans le cœur du quartier St Germain. Accueil très sympa et hôtel très fonctionnel. Je recommande :)

J’ai découvert l’hôtel la Louisiane dans le très vivant Quartier Latin, tout près de la place de l’Odéon et de la statue de Danton, en plein cœur de Saint-Germain des Prés. Cet hôtel presque bicentenaire poursuit avec foi sa mission : proposer aux voyageurs des séjours peu onéreux dans un cadre tout à la fois authentique et pratique.
 
Depuis les années 40, où s’y installèrent Jean-Paul Sartre, Simone de Beauvoir, Juliette Greco et tant d’autres personnalités de l’après-guerre, cet ancien dortoir de l’Abbaye Saint-Germain des Prés (fondée il y a 1.005 ans !) tient cette promesse avec constance, malgré les pressions de l’époque et la dictature du modernisme. Cela grâce d’abord à son propriétaire actuel, revenu tel l’enfant prodigue après avoir fait fortune comme pionnier de l’Internet, qui est le gardien des lieux pour la 4ème génération. Puisse-t-il être le passeur pour que ses enfants eux aussi conservent fidèlement La Louisiane pour ses habitants, voyageurs venant chaque année de plus de 120 différents pays.
 
Malgré une entrée modeste, cet immeuble labyrinthique abrite 82 chambres et autant de salles de bain : que d’eau, que d’eau chaude ! Il est difficile de s’en rendre compte au premier abord : la discrétion du bâtiment, où les murs Louis XIII voisinent une façade Art Déco, ne permet guère à l’esprit de projeter une image de ce qui l’attend. Silencieux et pudiques, ces murs de pierre construits au XIVème siècle, mais en reprenant des fondations qui datent de l’empire romain et de la Lutèce antique, rendent songeur tout en laissant une forme de doute s’installer. Pire, en montant, le dédale des chambres aux portes discrètes et anonymes (sauf celles recouvertes de dessins) balisent des couloirs mystérieux, dont Quentin Tarentino dit qu’ils sont un décor de thriller ! L’on s’y déplace pour trouver son nid le temps d’une saison, celle d’un voyage… sans autre objectif que d’être là, présent à cet instant.
 
Si l’entrée est petite, le suspens se dissipe vite. Dès que vous passerez la porte du 60 rue de Seine, vous y serez accueilli par une équipe de réceptionnistes constituée de vrais parisiens, connaisseurs des bons plans et des bonnes adresses tout autour. L’arrivée est rapide, l’attribution de votre chambre également, grâce à un Check In rodé. Vous avez à peine le temps de profiter du sofa du lounge au rez-de-chaussée, que clé en main, un ascenseur vous conduit à votre étage, où vous poserez vos valises avant de profiter du calme et de vous reposer… afin d’être frais pour replonger dans la foule des rues animées des alentours. Les célèbres terrasses pleines de belles personnes et de beaux esprits vous attendent, le Louvre, Notre-Dame de Paris, le Musée d’Orsay, le Jardin du Luxembourg sont justes à côté, et sur le trajet pour s’y rendre, autant de galeries d’art bordent les rues.
 
Vous vous installez dans une chambre simple et propre, souvent étonnamment  lumineuses grâce à des fenêtres aussi larges que hautes dans les premiers étages. Les chambres sont belles car elles sont pures, pures car elles sont simples, simples car elles se laissent facilement habiter par n’importe quel passager- voyageur, désireux d’y vivre un moment à lui, hors des routines de son logement habituel. Certes, les moines bénédictins de l’Abbaye Saint-Germain des Prés n’y vivent plus, mais la simplicité des cellules d’antan reste présente. Grâce à une décoration minimaliste, l’objet star est le lit, et la literie est, mais alors, très très confortable, et rassurante à la manière des objets que l’on a toujours connus et qui se laissent oublier. En se reposant sur ce lit, le moment dure et prend son temps…
 
Dès l’aube, à 7 heures du matin, jusqu’à 10h ou 11h le weekend, le petit-déjeuner vous attend à la Cafeteria, placée au centre du navire. Viennoiseries françaises du jour tout juste sorties du four du boulanger voisin, boissons chaudes – avec un excellent café livré par un torréfacteur à l’ancienne, fruits, laitages, céréales, fromages et charcuteries de petits producteurs composent l’essentiel du buffet dont on profitera généreusement au chant du coq ! Et l’on s’en régale dans une cafeteria boisée, laissée dans son jus depuis la nuit des temps : cela lui donne un tel cachet que vous vous y sentirez bien, à votre aise, libre d’avoir même les yeux fatigués ou l’esprit somnolant.
 
Ce « petit charme » des lieux exercera sur vous, au fil de vos séjours successifs, un magnétisme de plus en plus fort. Il découle du riche passé de l’hôtel La Louisiane, lieu de passage important à Odéon, chemin de traverses pour les vagabonds en quête d’émotions, les artistes en recherche d’inspiration, les voyageurs désireux de renouer avec un Paris oublié, quasi muet, populaire à souhait, à jamais rebelle et vibrant pour toujours.
 
Un dépaysement en plein cœur de Paris ? Oui, c’est même un livre qui s’ouvre. La paix, la méditation font leur entrée ou la passion s’anime, ou bien les trois, chacun à sa guise. Le film de Michel La Veaux, «  La Louisiane », raconte pendant une heure ce rapport que comble cet hôtel entre le besoin d’isolement, l’inspiration créatrice et la rencontre avec l’Autre qui passe et dort ici.
 
Si la vie d’un voyageur peut l’entrainer d’un point A à un point B, la Louisiane en décide autrement, prenant dans ses filets les nomades, les sages, les rêveurs, les poètes, les artistes, pour leur offrir le séjour de l’amitié.

The place is awesome location. I will definitely stay in La Lousiane again
Habitación reducida, lo demás bien
The best ever - charming- fun- artful- great location and great people/ wish I could just live there forever

If you’re looking for a place in the midst of an area with a true Parisian feel without breaking the bank, I believe this is a great choice. This place is not about the bells and whistles per se, but you can expect a clean room, a fantastic location and a wonderful staff that is super accommodating. I was especially thankful for how flexible the check in/check out times are as well as their willingness to allow us to leave our bags past check out to squeeze in an afternoon of sightseeing before making our way back home. The rooms themselves are a little older, but the beds are comfy, and we had what we needed. Being near many cafes, you walk out your door and have the pick of where you want to eat! We would definitely like to stay there again if we come back to Paris.

Paris isn’t cheap, so be mindful of getting what you pay for, and this “boutique” hotel will be just fine. Good checkin, decent breakfast, interesting people. A step up from a hostel, but good for a couple nights in a central location.

Quaint and very much central place in Paris, from which you can easily reach cafes, historical landmarks or just for a stroll by the Seine! (you just need to walk down the same street of the hotel). If I ever (hopefully!) come back to Paris, I would definitely stay here again.
Absolute gem of a hotel - such a great location, and the staff were wonderful. Will be returning when I can!
Lively location that’s great for getting feeling like your in the heart of some action.

Great location, our room faced the street and was noisy until about 2:00 am when the restaurants closed. All-in-all it was good for the one night we spent there. advertised as basic accommodations and that is what it was. If not for the street noise, this would have been a perfect place to stay.  WIFI was great.

Great atmospheric place. A little noisy if you like your windows open at night (no AC in a slightly stuffy room) but hey! this is Paris at 5.00am when they clean the streets of rubbish and lost tourists. And our room did not have a TV !! What a cute touch of nostalgia.

An older hotel but clean with a friendly staff. The location is excellent making it easy to walk to sites and the metro. Lots of art galleries in the neighborhood and many choices of cafes and restaurants. We would stay again.
Great location, easy to walk to Notre Dame and Musee d’Orsay.

Absolutely loved loved staying in La Lousianne!!! We came as a group of 8. They were accommodating and great fun. The location is brilliant (in St Germain) and there is really good late check out. Highly recommend!

This is a basic hotel just as they advertised with a great and gracious staff. It was a 15 min walk from everything you’d want to do in a great neighborhood with amenities within feet of the hotel door. I recommend getting the breakfast deal, it’s well done- that was the best decision on my part. Will definitely return!

The room was aged,  simple and unpretentious, just like in the description, but very clean and cozy. Located perfectly, friendly staff and a nice breakfast for an unbeatable price! Strongly recommended!
The place to stay in Paris. Best situated. Friendly people at the reception (24x7).  Clean. (Website hidden by Airbnb) said - the place to stay.

Hotel limpo, confortável,  perto de tudo, o quarto era um pouco quente, tinha um certo barulho dos bares e restaurantes próximos,  mas não me incomodou, a localização era excelente e o café da manhã era bem gostoso.
The place was super convenient and had tons of space.   It also came with few breakfast which was cool.   The only complaint I had was one of the rooms really smelled weird.

Simple, quaint place to stay if you enjoy being close to Paris’s attractions. Staff is friendly, breakfast is great. I goto bed late so I don’t mind the business of the streets. I enjoyed that there was a bathtub. I would stay here again.
Loved the location and friendly staff. In terms of the room, you pretty much get what you pay for.
It was amazing place to stay!
Terrific location and helpful folks!!

The staff here are excellent - helpful and informative.   The breakfast far surpassed my expectations as well!  We had a great time in the center of Paris where the energy is high and the options are plentiful and one can walk to many major sights.
Hotel la Lousiane is perfectly what we expected! Amazing location, very clean and a lovely view from our room. Very simple living spaces and kind hotel staff.
Thanks for a great place!! It was the exact perfect location to be in. The only thing was no ac in July, but with the fan and windows open it wasn’t awful

This hotel is in an great location and provided a basic room with a clean, comfortable bed and bathroom. We spent limited time there, but loved the location and would stay again. There is no air condition, but with the window open at night and the provided fan, it was comfortable to sleep in.
Great location. Reasonable price. The room is clean but small and a bit dated. Still good choice for short stay.
Super location and great connectivity. The hotel is as described and comfortable. Very warm and friendly staff. We really enjoyed our stay... Many Thanks
Great hosts, great location, great value.
Great location. The staff is kind and helpful. The rooms are simples but comfortable and charming. I hope I can come back some time soon.

Very nice place with wonderful hosts

Highly recommend
Great location!!
2nd time I have stayed over the last couple of (Website hidden by Airbnb) may not be the ritz but is still great value for money and the location is hard to beat
The hotel is a little dated and sober but the friendly staff and excellent location make up for a lot.

We had a very pleasant stay and the location was phenomenal!! It was a 10 min walk from Notre Dame, so close the banks of Seine, Louvre, Musee d’Orsay and right in the middle of a bustling and exciting St. Germain neighborhood. Also not that far of a walk from le marais.  Also two metro stations that can take you anywhere are right nearby. If I’m in Paris again I’ll stay there again! All the concierges did a wonderful job and were so helpful!! After they kindly offered to store my luggage so I could do some last min sightseeing , they saw me carrying pastries and offered to keep them fresh in the fridge. So thoughtful! My regards to all...
Great location, friendly staff, very comfortable bed.

It was very good stay with great flexibility in check in and check out. It was big help allowing early check in and late check out. The location is very good too..

Xavier's hotel is in the best location in Paris! And the hotel room is clean and the staff are really friendly. I like that they let the customers check out very late which is a big YES YES! I highly recommend this hotel
Old hotel on a great location.
My first AirBNB experience and it was better than expected. The place is in a wonderful location. Service/reception was amazing, and breakfast was great. Would definitely stay here again.

Great place to stay for a few nights in Paris, especially if you’re passing through. The location is amazing. If you’re looking to do touristy things it’s super central and walking distance to a lot. It’s also a great central location even if you’re not doing touristy things. It’s a very busy area, so if you’re a really light sleeper it might not be the best place for you. No complaints about my my room.  I definitely think they have the best check-in/check-out times in the area.

The location to me was one of the best parts for me. From easy connectivity to the metro, the night life just around the corner, there was so much this place offered to make my stay in Paris one to remember. Will definitely be back (soon)!
It is a place valid for the money that I pay!

Great value. Close to a number of great restaurants, and right across the street from a grocery store. However, the heater was running too hot in our room and we could not turn it down. Can get noisy in the street.

Will most defiantly stay at your hotel again. Great location and friendly staff. Very comfortable beds and clean no fuss hotel room. It was is the center of everything that you need in Paris. Great deal for what you get .
Muy buena ubicación, instalaciones sencillas con servicio, limpieza y atencion muy correcta.
Friendly and accommodating staff, in a great location with plenty of restaurants and a market to boot.

Great location with lots of shops and restaurants around. Also famous attractions are within about 20-minute- walking distance. 

Everything was ok for a short trip given that the hotel is an old building in Paris. Do not have high expectation.

Just as described! Perfect location, cafes , restaurants and metro right there so can’t beat it. Room a little dark so use the reception or common area for working. Spaces are good. 
Quaint and old as described. 
Nice staff! Clean.

I fly standby so making reservations is hard for me. I had no problem getting in here right away and it was nice having the early checkin with coming in at 7am. Thanks for making my first trip to Paris pleasurable!

Location, location, location.  This hotel is basic, but we were very happy with it based on our needs.   We wanted to be in the heart of the city and this is it!!  Shops, cafes, restaurants, Notre Dame, the Louvre all so close.  We appreciated the comfy beds, and clean bathroom.  We wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.
Xavier's place was a perfect find in our favorite part of Paris, there's a fresh food market just next door, tons of cafes, art galleries, a laundromat nearby ... and everyone was very kind.

Hotel La Louisiane is perfect for its central location with some lovely streets, small but very good typically french breakfast and a very helpful front desk. The hallways and rooms definitely have something old-school, but the beds were comfy and everything was superclean. Merci beaucoup!
Great location, close to restaurants and supermarket, they are just next to the hotel. Also, it’s close to several metro stations and bus stops. I would recommend this place to my friends.
Excelente ubicación, habitación cómoda. Servicio eficaz, práctico. Buena atención.

The location was perfect and an easy walk to the Louvre, Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame. The hotel itself is old, but has great character. The staff were all friendly and pleasant, the room was clean and the bathroom has some updates. The halls are very narrow and if your room is on the street side it can be noisy. The breakfast in the morning was a nice assortment of croissants, bread and muffins. There was also plain yogurt and compote, tea, coffee and orange juice. Overall it was a great place to stay in the heart of Paris for a reasonable price.
Ideally located, clean and comfortable, it’s for sure great value for money. Highly recommended!
Nice place to stay. Quite convenient to good food , attractions

This hotel is basic and old but in an amazing location. For the price, you can’t beat being right in the center of Paris, within walking distance of almost everything. The rooms are nothing special but they are clean and comfortable. The views out the windows are of
lively Paris streets which is great during the day and the windows do a good job of keeping sound out at night. My room was not air conditioned, but they provided a fan without me having to ask. I was there in August but the weather was mostly in the 70s so the fan was plenty. Reception was helpful and friendly and both check in and out were smooth. The complementary breakfast was standard French fare (bread, coffee and croissants) and very nice to have. 

I gave 4 stars for a few reasons. The building inside is a bit shabby. The carpet needs to be replaced and when I visited there were buckets on the stairs to catch drips from a leaky ceiling, however the buckets were gone by the time I left. Additionally, the WiFi is pretty weak. I was unable to FaceTime my husband but it worked well for everything else, although I regularly had to re-enter the password. Lastly, the metal lights by the bed get scalding hot. I bumped one accidentally as I was reaching to turn it off and the burn blistered immediately. I let the front desk know about this so it may be fixed soon but be careful. 

Overall, this is a great place for someone looking for something affordable and simple, right in the heart of the left bank.
Nice hotel, as advertised! The rooms were simple, but it is in a fantastic location, the breakfast is great, and the staff is friendly!
Located in the heart of Paris and in the happening street of Saint Germain, the rooms have a cozy setting, the hosts are hospitable and friendly. Recommended.

EL hotel se encuentra muy bien ubicado, desde allí se puede caminar casi a todas los sitios de interés en París (Louvre, jardines de Luxemburgo, Jardín Botánico y a 40 minutos la Torre Eiffel). No es un sitio tranquilo, hay demasiados restaurantes alrededor que tienen clientes hasta la madrugada en las aceras, algunas noches oímos peleas.  Hay muchos recursos disponibles alrededor (mercado, pan, entre otros)
El hotel se debe preocupar más por la limpieza de las habitaciones.

i stayed only one night and needed a taxi to the airport at 5 am. The hotel arranged the taxi with no problem. The place is well situated, very central, the room was big and very clean, so was the bathroom. The king size bed was comfortable. Efficient and friendly communication. Nice bars on the street, not for anyone seeking peace and quietness but perfect location for someone who likes to experience the very lively surroundings with esay, reasonable price. I recommend. Thank you!

The place is located in an ideal location in Paris surrounded by public transportation, restaurants, nightlife, and supermarket. The check-in was seamless and was given a guide-map to get around the city. The bed was comfy. Thanks for hosting!
Very good location!

This little hotel lies in the very heart of Paris, it offers everything one needs, even a little balcony to look down into one of the nice streets of the old town, and the people at the reception were extremely nice and friendly. The only thing that can be troublesome is that during the nice and warm nights, people sit in the street cafes until very late, which can be very noisy. The windows of hotel Lousiana are very good, so you don't hear much when you close them. On the whole, I really enjoyed my stay.

La habitación de Xavier es un hotel que te atienden las 24 hs. La ubicación es excelente muy cerca del barrio latino y de diferentes puntos de atracción como ser museos y parques. Enfrente hay un súper y está rodeado de bares y lugares para comer.

The position was great, right in the pulsing heart of Paris St. Germaine. I was worried about the noise, but didn't have any problem with it thanks to the good soundproof windows. Clean and stylish, very "parisienne", was missing of air conditioning but we were lucky the evenings were cool.
Great price based on position and quality.

This hotel is in a great location and is very clean. I was traveling  with my sister, husband, and four children ages six and under, so I was very grateful to find a place that could accommodate the seven of us. However, we visited Paris in July, and the rooms were not ventilated very well and did not have fans included that were up to the task. Also, the breakfast was disappointing, as it was missing some key items (cheese, fruit) to be called a typical French breakfast. The coffee was good. I don't think I would stay there if it were just me and my husband because I think I could find a place at a similar cost with a better breakfast. However, with me and my big family and so few choices, I would return if they would have me, but not in the heat of summer.
amazing location. worth staying.
Nicely central

Great accommodation in a vibrant part of town. This hotel has a storied history. It is close to subways,  and many restaurants. Best of all, the number of beds per room accommodated families very well. The staff was very courteous and accommodating. The breakfast was a simple continental and delicious start to every day.

You couldn’t ask for a better location in Paris!! The rooms are simple and definitely not luxurious, but they’re a perfect amount of space and feel very comfortable. The staff was wonderful and so welcoming. The check in and check out ours are marvelously convenient and generous. It’s in walking distance of all the great monuments of Paris, or at least of metro stops that will take you anywhere. I couldn’t give a higher recommendation! Awesome!
Great value, central location, large rooms for the area.  Staff made sure we got breakfast the morning before our coach picked us up.
Great location, clean room, and helpful staff. I had a wonderful stay. Thank you!!
I had a lovely stay here. Merci!
Great hotel! Amazing hosts and the neighborhood is fantastic. Will come back again !!
So happy with this hotel. Helpful, accommodating staff. Super comfortable beds. Clean comfortable rooms. Excellent location. Highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel is basic but clean and well located. However be warned you may not get the rooms you requested.  I booked rooms for a party of 12 and requested 4 double rooms and 2 twin rooms.  Xavier the host acknowledged this but on arrival we were given 2 double rooms and 2 four bed rooms which given we were a party of couples and friends was not acceptable. No apology or reduction in price was given for this.
Great value for money. An ideal location. Good-sized room with private bathroom. Adequate continental breakfast. A nice find in the heart of Paris.
Great helpful staff
A friendly hotel in central location with good value for money - what else do you want when visiting Paris. Next time will stay there again.
Excelente en cuanto ubicación, tiendas, metro y líneas de autobús. Incluso cerca del sena, notredame, jardines de Luxemburgo y luvre. Cuartos sencillos pero creo que justo lo que uno necesita.

This place is located in the middle of everything. A supermarket directly in-front, tons of shops and restaurants on the same street and in the surrounding areas. Close to Metro and the river. Absolutely perfect location, central to major attractions. The room is clean, small breakfast included and the staff is friendly enough. WiFi no issues. Would stay again. You cannot go wrong with this place. Merci
Really central place - basic but it has everything you need.
Local charmoso e muito agradável, localização top. Pertinho de tudo!!!
Perfekt planering i Paris. Trevlig personal. Bra städning. Enkel standard i rum utan tv. Enkel, men god frukost.
The location was great. The room was a bit old but it provides the essentials. There are some noises throughout the night, but it's Paris, had the same experience with other hotels previously
Loved staying in such a historic hotel! It’s super central and funky with cool lounge areas and a great breakfast. I’ll be back!!
The hotel is very clean and people are nice.
Sehr zentral. Ideal, um fast alles zu Fuss zu erreichen
buon equilibrio tra prezzo e servizi, peccato che manchi la televisione nelle camere.

The Hotel Lousinane was a great way to stay inexpensively in very central paris. The hotel felt clean even if some areas of the hotel/rooms feel a bit aged. The bathrooms were very clean. The breakfast was simple but tasty - even decent coffee! I'll return to this hotel (even asked as I checked-out whether they had rooms available in April) but I will bring earplugs since the area, though well located, can be a bit noisy.
Awesome spot. Very clean
nice
This locale is in the center of the sixth arrondissement. The center. Parfait!

Highly recommend this hotel. Fantastic location.  Rooms small but adequate, very clean.  Check in was available when we arrived at 10am, which is always great. Staff very helpful and printed some train tickets for us.  Breakfast very good. Only criticism is dining room way too hot!  But would definitely recommend to anyone who wants a great value hotel in fantastic location
Really peaceful room with a lovely rooftop view. Amazing value for staying just one night. Thank you.
Great little boutique hotel, quirky and convenient to excellent night life. Great value, did the job perfectly.
Excellent.
Wonderful neighborhood and super prompt communication when I was in a bind! Will be back.
Cannot beat the location of this (Website hidden by Airbnb) was a great stay for the four nights we stayed
This place was very nice, it was very central and close to so many restaurants and shops! Great place to stay!
房子住宿不错,但是是一家旅馆｡如果多人直接现场订的话有时候反而比在爱彼迎上便宜｡
Todo bárbaro. Muy cómodo en general.
The host canceled this reservation 27 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Il posto è centralissimo e per chi va al parcour des mondes è assolutamente fantastico perché è proprio al centro di tutto. Siamo stati accolti molto bene e abbiamo passato due giorni perfetti. Grazie a Xavier e a tutto il suo staff.

Simple room, clean and equipped with mini fridge, desk, and semi-open closet. Bathroom is clean and stocked with shampoos and towels. Daily cleaning service and breakfast were good. Location is very central in the St Germain-de-Près, many great restaurants and shops nearby, walkable to many sites of interest.
beautiful location within walking distance of many great things to do in Paris!
Amazing hotel, great location and the staff were so helpful and kind! Will definitely stay here again!!
Es un hotel en un barrio donde hay mucha vida, hay muchos lugares para cenar, Xavier es una persona muy responsable, mi estadía acá estuvo genial, muy recomendable.

Excelente ubicación, buena habitación de hotel con cama cómoda y buen baño. Ubicado en pleno barrio latino cerca del Sena. Cerca de restaurantes y animaciones. Frente hay un supermercado que puede ser un poco ruidoso en la mañana temprano por la descarga de mercadería. Incluye desayuno. En resumen excelente relación calidad precio

If you don't plan on being home or cooped up in a room while you are staying in Paris, Xavier's accommodations will more than suit you.  He has all you need and his staff is very friendly and accommodating.  There is an amazing history to his place!  Would definitely stay here again!

Hotel is on nice place in Paris, around the hotel is full of different restaurant and art gallery. 
You have easy access to metro.
Rooms are OK and clean. People of hotel are really friendly.

N’ayez aucune hésitation,
Hôtel parfait
Une belle chambre de bonne, propre mais minuscule dans un hôtel 3*. La photo présenté n'a pas de rapport avec la réalité !

Prestation très correcte comte tenu de l'emplacent.

Chambre propre, respect des normes sanitaires consécutives à la covid, accueil agréable et souriant.

Hotel au top : un accueil très chaleureux et souriant. La chambre est confortable, propre, et agréable (pas de bruits, pas de dérangement, ...). L’hôtel est situé à Place d’Italie, avec une accessibilité aux transports et aux commerces facile.

Plus grand que ce que je pensais, très confortable, bien sécurisé avec un accueil agréable. Bon rapport qualité prix, je recommande.
Très bon accueil. Petite chambre confortable et propre à deux pas de la place d'Italie. Excellent rapport qualité prix.

Hôtel très sympathique, avec une personne à l'accueil en permanence. 
Idéalement situé place d'Italie dans une petite rue calme et à proximité immédiate du métro. Chambre petite mais très confortable. Nous n'avons pas pris le petit déjeuner sur place.

Très bel hôtel, à un tarif défiant toute concurrence. Malgré l'absence de réponse de "l'hôte" à mon message - et pour cause, puisque c'est un hôtel - personnel sur place très agréable. Donc, pas vraiment un Airbnb, mais pour 60 euros la nuit, expérience exceptionnelle.

J'avais réservé cet hôtel la veille de notre arrivée avec comme premier critère : la mise à disposition d'un lit pour bébé. Sur les points négatifs : le matelas du lit bébé n'était pas vraiment adapté (cela ressemblait à une couette épaisse) et il n'y avait pas de baignoire pour bébé (demandée à l'accueil) alors que c'était indiqué dans les équipements sur le site AirBnB. Je passe sur l'aspect petit, pour lequel nous étions effectivement prévenus à l'avance.
Pour les points positifs : matelas pour adulte très bon. Chambre très propre, refaite à neuf récemment (moins de quelques années) avec un très bon confort. Personnel très accueillant. J'y retournerai probablement car il reste très bien placé et d'un bon rapport qualité/prix.
Correspond à l'offre proposée sur air bnb : je recommande !

Farouk est très disponible et agréable.

Très propre, pro, confortable, bien placé, agréable

Très bonne exposition de la chambre  pas de bruit, le lit était confortable, propreté et services irréprochable. Je recommande vivement.
café et thé a volonté

Un hôtel parmi les airbnb. Cependant bon accueil.
Une chambre assez petite mais on y dort bien, une salle de bain en couloir. ll ne faut pas être trop gros ;)

L’hôtel était très bien situé avec une station de métro à proximité. La chambre était très bien.
Bonne chambre d’hôtel mais salle de bains pas du tout pratique.
Petite chambre bien agencée,  propre,  efficacement placé (place d'Italie) . Idéal pour une petite escale sur Paris.  Accueil impeccable.
